algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) to calculate level sums, then QuickSelect (nth_element) to find the kth largest.
problem_summary_simple: Find the kth largest sum of node values at each level in a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Utilizes BFS to compute level sums, storing them in a list. Applies QuickSelect (nth_element) for efficient kth largest element retrieval.
key_insights: BFS is a natural fit for level-order traversal and calculating level sums.
QuickSelect provides an average O(n) solution for finding the kth largest element, avoiding a full sort.
Handle the edge case where k is larger than the number of levels.
